intro: Echium pycnanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Echium pycnanthum is often found in dry, sunny habitats like grasslands and rocky soils.
